thread.title: Italian markets hit by fears of govt spending binge

title: Italian markets hit by fears of govt spending binge
text:
Italian markets hit by fears of govt spending binge 01:46
Italy's two anti-establishment parties have promised to ramp up spending in a programme for a new coalition government, putting them on a collision course with the European Union despite having dropped some of their most radical proposals. As Sonia Legg reports, it sent Italy's long-term borrowing costs up to more than seven-month highs while stocks in Milan fell more than one percent. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript
Italy's two anti-establishment parties have promised to ramp up spending in a programme for a new coalition government, putting them on a collision course with the European Union despite having dropped some of their most radical proposals. As Sonia Legg reports, it sent Italy's long-term borrowing costs up to more than seven-month highs while stocks in Milan fell more than one percent.
